page.title: 20SILVER-STUDDED BUTTERFLY.
page.content: Martlesham Heath is one of the last strongholds in Suffolk of the rapidly declining silver-studded blue butterfly In July 1985 Suffolk Coastal Council planning committee gave permission for a further 122 homes to be built on heathland adjoining the present Martlesham New Village by the Bradford Property Trust. Outline approval had been granted before the significance of the site was realised. Conservationists opposed to the development have warned of the potential destruction of half the colony of the butterflies. Efforts are to be made by the Suffolk Trust for Nature Conservation to save the remaining habitat. The developers have agreed to fence off the building area from adjacent heathland and to phase the construction of houses to allow further study of the butterflies this year and next year.
